summary: REQ-1 and REQ-2 appear implemented via a labeled Select dropdown on the main screen with the four specified dance styles, selection state reflected in UI, and a consistent themed layout/colors. However, the diff also introduces authentication/Internet Identity infrastructure, an actor hook, and extra informational content not requested and potentially outside the stated non-goals.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduces Internet Identity authentication provider/context and related hooks (login/identity handling), which is explicitly out of scope (non-goal: no authentication changes).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly states authentication changes (sign-in) are out of scope; diff adds InternetIdentityProvider and extensive auth logic.

hallucinated_features.description: Adds actor creation/query hook tied to identity (backend actor wiring) which is not requested for a simple dropdown UI and conflicts with non-goal of not persisting to backend.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not request backend integration or actor/query setup; diff adds useActor using react-query and identity-based actor creation.

hallucinated_features.description: Adds a backend canister file with an empty actor, which is not requested by the frontend-only UI requirements.
hallucinated_features.reason: No backend changes are required/mentioned for adding a dropdown and theme; diff adds backend/main.mo.

hallucinated_features.description: Adds conditional “Info Cards”/descriptive content that changes based on selected dance style (additional content/behavior beyond showing the selected value).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-1 only requires showing the currently selected value; REQ-2 forbids new functionality beyond styling/layout. Dynamic informational panels per selection constitute an extra product feature/content not requested.
